data.enText: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment
He will require surgery on his left knee.

data.text: In American English the countable form can be used:

data.enText: She had three surgeries over ten days.

data.text: 美国英语可用复数形式：She had three surgeries over ten days.

data.enText: the time during which a doctor, dentist or vet is available to see patients

data.chText: 上午 / 下午 / 晚间应诊时间

data.enText: Is there a surgery this evening?
a place where a doctor, dentist or vet sees patients

data.chText: 医生的 / 牙医的诊室

data.enText: a time when people can meet their Member of Parliament to ask questions and get help

tr: a medical procedure involving an incision with instruments
performed to repair damage or arrest disease in a living body
example: they will schedule the operation as soon as an operating room is available

tr: a room in a hospital equipped for the performance of surgical operations
example: great care is taken to keep the operating rooms aseptic

tr: a room where a doctor or dentist can be consulted
example: he read the warning in the doctor's surgery

tr: the branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures
example: he is professor of surgery at the Harvard Medical School

value.def: Surgery is medical treatment in which someone's body is cut open so that a doctor can repair, remove, or replace a diseased or damaged part.

example.ex: His father has just recovered from heart surgery...
example.tran: 他父亲刚刚从心脏外科手术中康复过来。

example.ex: Mr Clark underwent five hours of emergency surgery.
example.tran: 克拉克先生经受了 5 个小时的外科急救手术。

value.def: A surgery is the room or house where a doctor or dentist works.

example.ex: Bill was in the doctor's surgery demanding to know what was wrong with him.
example.tran: 比尔在医生的诊疗室里想要知道自己到底得了什么病。

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 doctor's office, dentist's office

value.def: A doctor's surgery is the period of time each day when a doctor sees patients at his or her surgery.

example.ex: His surgery always ends at eleven.
example.tran: 他的出诊时间总是到11点结束。

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 office hours

value.def: In Britain, when someone such as an MP or a local councillor holds a surgery, they go to an office where members of the public can come and talk to them about problems or issues that concern them.
A surgery is the room in a hospital where surgeons operate on their patients.

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 theatre, operating theatre
